* Custom exception class for DaddyBot application.
* Parser class to parse user input and execute commands.
* Parses user input and executes corresponding commands.
* @param scanner Scanner object to read user input.
public static void parse(Scanner scanner, String input, ArrayList<Task> list) {
Ui.border("daddy needs a /by to know the deadline.");
Deadline deadline = new Deadline(daddyTask(input).substring(9, seperatorIndex).trim(), byDate);
Ui.border("daddy needs both /from and /to to know the event time.");
Event event = new Event(daddyTask(input).substring(5, seperatorIndexFrom).trim(), fromDate, toDate);
Ui.border("daddy could not find that task.");
Ui.border("daddy is proud of you!\n" + list.get(index).getStatusIcon() + " " + list.get(index).toString());
Ui.border("daddy could not find that task.");
Ui.border("daddy could not find that task.");
System.out.println("daddy couldn't find any matching tasks.");
* Checks if the input ends with "please daddy".
* @return True if the input ends with "please daddy", false otherwise.
* Removes "please daddy" from the end of the input string to see user's input.
* Provides responses when the user forgets to say "please daddy".
* @param num The number of times the user has forgotten to say "please daddy".
Ui.addBorder("daddy won't do it unless you say 'please daddy'");
Ui.addBorder("if you continue being naughty, daddy will punish you.");
Ui.addBorder("daddy's getting angry... one more time and daddy is going to leave.");
* Checks if the task description is empty before adding it to the list.
* @param task The task to be added.
* @throws DaddyException If the task description is empty.
public static void isEmpty(Task task, ArrayList<Task> list) throws DaddyException {
throw new DaddyException("daddy can't add an empty task.");
* Handles file storage operations for DaddyBot.

* Ui class to handle user interactions.
* Displays the welcome message and instructions.
addBorder("daddy can add todo, deadline and event tasks.\n\n"
+ "to mark a task as done, type mark <task number>.\nto unmark a task, type unmark <task number>.\n"

+ "to delete a task, type delete <task number>.
to view all tasks, type list.

"
+ "be sure to add 'please daddy' at the end of your input.\n"
* Displays a border around a message.
* @param message Message to be displayed between the border.
* Represents a deadline task with a description and a due date.
* Returns a string representation of the deadline task, including its status,
* description, due date, and the number of days until or past the deadline.
* @return A formatted string representing the deadline task.
return "[D]" + super.getStatusIcon() + " " + super.getDesc() + " (by: " + by + ") - overdue by (" + Math.abs(daysBetween) + ") days";
return "[D]" + super.getStatusIcon() + " " + super.getDesc() + " (by: " + by + ") - due in (" + daysBetween + ") days";
* Gets the due date of the deadline task.
* @return The due date as a LocalDate object.
* Represents an event task with a description, start date, and end date.
public Event(String desc, LocalDate from, LocalDate to) {
* Returns a string representation of the event task.
* @return String representation of the event task.
return "[E]" + super.getStatusIcon() + " " + super.getDesc() + " (from: " + from + " to: " + to + ")";

assertEquals("todo list ", Parser.daddyTask("todo list please daddy"));
